alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 11:09PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Shannon County through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1109 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Birch Tree, or 10 miles northeast of Mountain View, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Winona, Birch Tree, Montier, Alley Spring, Teresita and Pine Crest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
